description: Manage rules in a route filter.

commands.name: az network route-filter rule create
commands.summary: Create a rule in a route filter.
commands.syntax:
az network route-filter rule create --filter-name
                                    --name
                                    --resource-group
                                    [--access {Allow, Deny}]
                                    [--communities]
                                    [--location]
                                    [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
examples: az network route-filter rule create -g MyResourceGroup --filter-name MyRouteFilter -n MyRouteFilterRule --communities 12076:5040 --access Allow

commands.name: az network route-filter rule delete
commands.summary: Delete a rule from a route filter.
commands.syntax:
az network route-filter rule delete [--filter-name]
                                    [--ids]
                                    [--name]
                                    [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                    [--resource-group]
                                    [--subscription]
examples: az network route-filter rule delete -g MyResourceGroup --filter-name MyRouteFilter -n MyRouteFilterRule

commands.name: az network route-filter rule list
commands.summary: List rules in a route filter.
examples: az network route-filter rule list -g MyResourceGroup --filter-name MyRouteFilter

commands.name: az network route-filter rule list-service-communities
commands.summary: Gets all the available BGP service communities.
examples: az network route-filter rule list-service-communities -o table
az network route-filter rule list-service-communities --query '[].bgpCommunities[?communityName==`Exchange`].[communityValue][][]' -o tsv

commands.name: az network route-filter rule show
commands.summary: Get the details of a rule in a route filter.
examples: az network route-filter rule show -g MyResourceGroup --filter-name MyRouteFilter -n MyRouteFilterRule

commands.name: az network route-filter rule update
commands.summary: Update a rule in a route filter.
commands.syntax:
az network route-filter rule update [--add]
                                    [--filter-name]
                                    [--force-string {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                    [--ids]
                                    [--name]
                                    [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                    [--remove]
                                    [--resource-group]
                                    [--set]
                                    [--subscription]
examples: az network route-filter rule update -g MyResourceGroup --filter-name MyRouteFilter -n MyRouteFilterRule --add communities='12076:5010'

commands.name: az network route-filter rule wait
commands.summary: Place the CLI in a waiting state until a condition is met.
